subject: Cybersecurity
title: Two-Factor Authentication: Something You Know + Something You Have
description: Learn Two-Factor Authentication: Something You Know + Something You Have in one minute.

hook.text: A stolen password alone can't get in if the attacker also needs your physical phone. That's two-factor authentication.

buildup.text: 2FA requires two different factors: knowledge (password), possession (phone/token), or inherence (biometric).

discovery.text: Even if your password is compromised, 2FA blocks 99.9% of automated attacks because attackers lack the second factor.

twist.text: Despite being almost free to implement, only 28% of Microsoft users enable 2FA. Most breaches could have been prevented.

climax.text: 2FA dramatically raises the cost of an attack. Stealing a password is easy; stealing a password AND a phone is.

punchline.text: 99.9% of attacks stopped. Only 28% of people bother.

quiz.question: What percentage of automated attacks does 2FA block?
